conbody.p: functionsmiscellaneous functionsmiscellaneous functionsdescriptionThe expression language provides the following miscellaneous functions:

dlentry.dd: Returns the Java heap size allocated to the . You can use this function in an expression to specify the maximum amount of memory a pipeline can use.
Returns the value for the specified runtime configuration. Use to call a runtime property.

Uses the following argument:
runtime configuration name - Name of the configuration property to use. The property must defined in the sdc.properties file or in a runtime configuration file specified in the sdc.properties file.
Returns the value in the specified file. Use to call a runtime resource.

Uses the following arguments:
file name - Name of the file that contains the information to be loaded. The file should reside in the following location: <SDCinstalldir>/resources
restricted - Whether the file has restricted permissions. If set to true, the file must be owned by the system user who runs the and read and writable only by the owner.
For more information about runtime resources, see .

Returns the ID.
When the runs in standalone execution mode, the ID is a unique identifier associated with the , such as 58efbb7c-faf4-4d8e-a056-f38667e325d0. The ID is stored in the following file: <SDCinstalldir>/data/sdc.id.
When the runs in cluster mode, the ID is the worker partition ID generated by Spark.
